li.a: Celebrating Cedarburg's Rich History of Education

div.h2: Celebrating Cedarburg's Rich History of Education

div.p: The mission of the Cedarburg School District is to provide an exemplary education that challenges
students in a nurturing environment to develop into lifelong learners, to become responsible adults,
and to achieve their goals and dreams.

div.h3: 2020 Wisconsin Title I School of Recognition
div.p: Congratulations to the staff and students of Westlawn Elementary! The school is among 107 schools in the state that were named the 2020 Wisconsin Title I School of Recognition, honored with an award as a High-Achievement School. More information can be found on the DPI’s website.

div.h3: CHS Among America's Most Challenging High Schools
div.p: Just released for 2019,The Washington Post has ranked CHS among the most challenging high schools in the country; #1 in Wisconsin for public, non-charter high schools, and for all high schools, #2 in Wisconsin and #399 nationally. This ranks CHS in the top 2% of high schools in the country. Read More...

div.h3: Cedarburg among the top 1% of public high schools
div.p: Congratulations to our staff and students! For the fifth year in a row, Cedarburg High School has been recognized on an annual list of “Best High Schools” published by US News & World Report. For 2019, CHS ranked #1 in WI and #121 nationally of more than 17,000 schools.

Congratulations to Webster Middle School for being recognized as a PBIS School of Merit by the DPI and WI RtI Center. Their effort in implementing and creating a system to meet the needs of ALL students is rewarding work that takes the determination of many. Webster was recognized at the Silver level in the content areas of Behavior and Reading and at the Bronze level in Mathematics. Congratulations Staff!

We are proud to announce Cedarburg School District is once again included in the online NICHE school rankings for 2019. Of all WI schools, CSD is ranked #5 as "Best School District", #3 as “Districts with Best Teachers”, and #1 as “Safest School Districts” and we are honored to be consistently ranked nationally among top districts in the U.S! Congratulations to our staff and students for this outstanding recognition!

div.h3: CHS Among the Best High Schools in the Nation For 2018
div.p: For the fourth year, CHS has been recognized by U.S. News & World Report on their annual list of Best High Schools in the nation. For 2018, CHS ranked #3 in the state and #399 in the nation receiving our third gold medal. Congratulations to our outstanding students and staff!

Congratulations to Parkview Elementary School for being recognized as a PBIS School of Merit by the DPI and WI RtI Center. Their effort in implementing and creating a system to meet the needs of ALL students is rewarding work that takes the determination of many.Parkview was recognized at the Silver level in the content area of Behavior. Congratulations Staff!

Congratulations toThorson Elementary School for being recognized as a PBIS School of Merit by the DPI and WI RtI Center. Their effort in implementing and creating a system to meet the needs of ALL students is rewarding work that takes the determination of many.Thorson was recognized at the Silver level in the content area of Behavior. Congratulations Staff!

Congratulations to Westlawn Elementary School for being recognized as a PBIS School of Merit by the DPI and WI RtI Center. Their effort in implementing and creating a system to meet the needs of ALL students is rewarding work that takes the determination of many.Westlawn was recognized at the Silver level in the content area of Behavior. Congratulations Staff!

Proclamations
The State of Wisconsin declared the following proclamations: March 2-6, 2020 – National School Breakfast Week March 1-31, 2020 – Middle Level Education Month April 1-30, 2020 – Military Child Month

div.p: The State of Wisconsin declared the following proclamations:

February 2020 -Career and Technical Education Month
February 2-8, 2020 -SkillsUSA Week
February 2-8, 2020 -Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA) Week
February 3-7, 2020 -National School Counseling Week
February 10-14, 2020 -Family, Career and Community Leaders of America (FCCLA) Week
February 22-29, 2020 -Future Farmers of America (FFA) Week
The State of Wisconsin declared the following proclamation:

Adult School Crossing Guard Recognition Week, January 13-17, 2020.
Please remember to thank our CSD school crossing guards for their service!!!
4K & 5K Registration is February 11! Click HERE for details!
The State of Wisconsin declared the following proclamations:
American Education Week, November 18-22, 2019
Computer Science Education Week, December 9-15, 2019

Newsweek announced its ranking of the top 5,000 STEM high schools for 2020, honoring excellence in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Cedarburg High School was named #1 in Wisconsin and #157 in the Nation. Read More
The Wisconsin Department of Instruction (DPI) recently released the School and District Report Cards based on the state assessments from the 2018-19 school year. PRESS RELEASE
InsideCSD | The district's new community newsletter. We hope you enjoy learning and sharing news about Cedarburg School District.
The State of Wisconsin declared the following proclamations:

National School Lunch Week, October 14–18, 2019
Gifted Education Month, the month of October
Keeping Kids Safe Online Month, the month of October
National Principals Month, the month of October
Check out up-to-date information on the Building Project. Each week we will share updates on construction, featuring what’s been completed for the week and what’s coming up.

CSD Receives $171,041 in Round Two School Safety Grant | AG Schimel Announces More Than $21.3 Million in School Safety Grant Funding to 263 School Districts that focuses on initiatives to bolster student mental health. Read More
Congratulations to our staff and students!! CSD is proud to announce we have been selected as the best school district in WI by 24/7 Wall St. Read more....

On September 27, WI DPI released the ACT statewide scores from the 2016-17 school year revealing that Cedarburg School District students continue to perform at exceptional levels. CHS had the highest ACT Composite score in the state with a score of 25.19, #1 in the state! Our entire senior class of 292 students contributed to the overall score, leading the way for the 65,180 students statewide that took the test. Congratulations! Read More...
